notes.text:
This update for file-roller fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2020-11736: Fixed a directory traversal vulnerability due to improper checking whether a file's parent is an external symlink (bsc#1169428).
- CVE-2019-16680: Fixed a path traversal vulnerability which could have allowed
  an overwriting of a file during extraction (bsc#1151585).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

relationships.relates_to_product_reference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Desktop Applications 15 SP1

notes.text: An issue was discovered in GNOME file-roller before 3.29.91. It allows a single ./../ path traversal via a filename contained in a TAR archive, possibly overwriting a file during extraction.
notes.title: CVE description

recommended: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Desktop Applications 15 SP1:file-roller-3.26.2-4.5.1.aarch64

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: fr-archive-libarchive.c in GNOME file-roller through 3.36.1 allows Directory Traversal during extraction because it lacks a check of whether a file's parent is a symlink to a directory outside of the intended extraction location.
notes.title: CVE description
